item.title: The Martyrdom of Stephen
item.description: Stephen is tried before the council. He recounts the history of Israel and names Moses as a prototype of Christ. He testifies of the apostasy in Israel and he sees Jesus on the right hand of God.

item.title: The Promised Blessings of Family History
item.description: This video has all the recent promises given by general authorities about doing family history work, and how it will bless our lives here and now, not just our deceased ancestors.

item.title: A Haven from Gang Violence: The Compton Junior Posse Equestrians
item.description: In the Compton Junior Posse, the kids can ride and take care of horses, but they have to be doing well in school in order to participate.

item.title: Baptists and Mormons Working Together: Tutoring Struggling Kids in Los Angeles
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and a local Baptist church have teamed up to help tutor kids from struggling communities and families in Los Angeles.

item.title: Crocheting for a Difference
item.description: Ellen wanted to find a way to give back. She began crocheting toys to donate to the Idaho Falls humanitarian center.

item.title: Missionary Open House
item.description: Two sisters accept a challenge from their Stake President to have missionaries and friends in their home more often. They created a monthly event called "Cake and Ice Cream" to gather friends and listen to a spiritual thought from missionaries.

item.title: A Father Indeed
item.description: The story of a committed husband and father who consistently and passionately demonstrates his love and devotion to his wife and kids.

item.title: Forgiveness: My Burden Was Made Light
item.description: Forgiveness and the power of Jesus Christ enable a man to survive losing his wife and several children in a car accident—and allow the offending driver to begin rebuilding his own life.

item.title: Blessings of the Priesthood
item.description: The priesthood is the power of God, which is given to man to act in His name. It is here on the earth today. The blessings of the priesthood are available to everyone.

item.description: (1 of 7) President Eyring discusses covenants made through the power of the priesthood and teaches that the priesthood changes hearts and knits individuals together in eternal families.

item.title: Examples in Ministering
item.description: (7 of 7) President Eyring testifies that the Savior Jesus Christ is the greatest minister. Christ showed unmatched respect for His mother. He ministered powerfully among the women, children, and men who were spiritually drawn to Him.

category.title: Mormon and Gay
category.subtitle: Videos: 11

item.title: Laurie’s story—A Flicker of Light That Brought Me Back to the Savior
item.description: Laurie has put a gun in her mouth more than once, but her finger would always freeze on the trigger. She knows life isn’t going to be pretty, but she knows that with God and her family, she can do it.

item.title: Tonya’s Story—A Mother’s Love and Support
item.description: Andy is everything his mom could ask for. He’s a triple major, he works full-time, he’s in his elder’s quorum presidency, he’s the best big brother and he’s gay.

item.title: Ricardo’s Story—Reaching Out toward the Light
item.description: Ricardo has found peace with God while being authentic to himself by accepting the Atonement of Christ.

item.title: Ricardo’s Journey through His Art
item.description: Ricardo has always loved his wife and while he hoped his feelings of same-sex attraction would disappear, they haven’t. See why his wife says being sympathetic and welcoming is the best we can do to help.

item.title: Elizabeth’s Take on Love and Understanding
item.description: Ricardo has tried his whole life to piece together the big picture. But, it wasn’t until he balanced the love and support of his wife, children and friends that he was able to find peace as a gay Mormon.

item.title: Jessyca’s Story—Coming Out, the Most Healing Thing I Have Ever Done
item.description: Jessyca tried to keep her feelings buried; she didn’t want to admit that she was gay, but, by understanding what she wants and staying close to God, she found how she can live the gospel and be happy.

item.title: Jessyca—The Struggles and the Good That Come from Trials
item.description: She knows she doesn’t want to marry a man or a woman. What Jessyca does know is that she wants to remain temple worthy. Now, she can make a plan for her life, trusting that God knows what’s best.

item.title: Jessyca’s Three Crucial Questions That Changed Her Life
item.description: Just because she understands what she wants in life doesn’t make being a gay Mormon easy. See how Jessyca wants to use her experience and passion to help lift others.

item.title: Josh’s Afterlife Analogy
item.description: Through crucial conversations with God, Josh has learned that he does not have to have all the answers about the afterlife now. He has learned that he has to exercise faith to reach ultimate happiness.

item.title: Josh’s Table Analogy
item.description: To Josh, the gospel was like being seated at a table where only those in a heterosexual relationship can partake of the gospel’s great food.

item.title: Reed—A Father’s Blessing
item.description: Reed and Josh share how their relationship was deeply touched when Josh received a priesthood blessing. Josh’s same-sex attraction experience has been blessed by expressions of love from his father and other family members.

item.title: Bullied - Let Us Be Kind
item.description: This simple story illustrates the power of love and forgiveness in the face of bullying.

item.title: The Last Testimonies
item.description: We are blessed to learn from the final testimonies of those latter-day prophets and apostles who have passed away. https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2015/10/chosen-to-bear-testimony-of-my-name?lang=eng

item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland discusses how we can draw closer to God on the Sabbath.

item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland discusses how we can honor the Sabbath.

item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland discuses keeping the Sabbath day holy.

category.title: Mental Health
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: Living with Depression
item.description: When Heather first recognized the symptoms of her depression, she felt ashamed. She also felt sure that with faith, prayer, and help from Jesus Christ, the depression could be taken away. She learned that prayers are answered in unexpected ways.

item.title: Living Beyond “What If?” | Cambry Kaylor
item.description: Cambry Kaylor was a promising equestrian vaulter with dreams of competing internationally. At age 18 she suffered an accident while vaulting, leaving her a paraplegic, but that didn’t stop her from achieving her dreams.

item.title: A Spirit of Unity
item.description: Young Women Class Presidency Meetings Part 1: A Laurel Class Presidency works together to achieve unity as they serve their fellow Young Women.

item.title: So Great a Cause
item.description: Young Women Class Presidency Meetings Part 2: A Laurel Class Presidency plans and carries out ministering service as they strive to be an example to others around them.

item.title: If Ye Are Prepared
item.description: A Laurel learns the importance of preparation as she tries, and tries again, to successfully conduct Young Women opening exercises.
